page.title: 02TOURISM IN THE BARR AREA
page.content: In the summer months many tourists travel into the Carrick hills to visit the conservation village of Barr.There are two hotels in the village and both are geared to the tourist trade providing meals,refreshments and accommodation.Tourists are usually in the area to take advantage of trout or salmon fishing in the river Stinchar or coarse-fishing in the many hill lochs in the Carrick Forest which is part of the larger Glen Trool Forest Park.Hill-walking is a most popular outdoor activity with most spectacular views of many of the highest Southern Upland peaks and views across the Firth of Clyde from Auchensoul Hill (310m)1km.W.N.W.of the village. Villagers benefit from the passing tourist trade by baking for the Tea Room,waiting at the tables and selling locally made crafts.
